cli.title: ENEM TRI Calculator
cli.subtitle: Estimate your ENEM scores based on correct answers
cli.input_prompt: Please enter your correct answers for each area:

prompts.range_error: Please enter a value between {min} and {max}

info.about_tri_desc: The ENEM uses TRI instead of simple correct answer counting. This means:
info.tri_point_1: Not all questions have the same weight
info.tri_point_2: Scoring is based on statistical models
info.tri_point_2_desc: Uses parameters: difficulty, discrimination, and guessing
info.tri_point_3_desc: Pattern of correct/incorrect answers affects the score
info.about_calculator_desc: This calculator provides ESTIMATES based on:
info.calc_point_1: Historical ENEM data and statistical patterns
info.calc_point_2: Logistic curve models approximating TRI behavior
info.calc_point_3: Average score distributions by number of correct answers
info.limitations_1: Exact item parameters are partially confidential
info.limitations_2: Estimates may differ from official scores
info.limitations_3: For educational and planning purposes only
info.more_info: For more information, see the documentation in the docs/ folder.

disclaimer.warning: These are ESTIMATED scores based on statistical models.
disclaimer.official: Official scores can only be provided by INEP/MEC.
disclaimer.confidential: The actual TRI calculation uses specific item parameters that are partially confidential.

commands.calculate_help: Calculate estimated ENEM scores based on correct answers
commands.info_help: Display information about the TRI methodology and data sources
commands.estimate_area_help: Estimate score for a single area

options.mathematics_help: Number of correct answers in Mathematics
options.languages_help: Number of correct answers in Languages
options.natural_sciences_help: Number of correct answers in Natural Sciences
options.human_sciences_help: Number of correct answers in Human Sciences

errors.invalid_range: Error: Correct answers must be between 0 and 45
